title: Protein Thermal Stability Regulation Strategies Using Molecular Dynamics Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Strengthens computational protein engineering design capabilities to compensate for limitations in experimental approaches.

learning_goals: The role of surface residues (Asp/Glu) related to thermal stability can be analyzed and explained at the molecular level
Thermodynamic properties of protein variants can be quantitatively evaluated using MD simulations
A project comparing/predicting thermal stability differences among variants through RMSD data interpretation can be conducted
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
